metadata.Title: CVE-2020-5275 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
In symfony/security-http before versions 4.4.7 and 5.0.7, when a `Firewall`checks access control rule, it iterate overs each rule's attributes andstops as soon as the accessDecisionManager decides to grant access on theattribute, preventing the check of next attributes that should have beentake into account in an unanimous strategy. The accessDecisionManager isnow called with all attributes at once, allowing the unanimous strategybeing applied on each attribute. This issue is patched in versions 4.4.7and 5.0.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-5275` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony - 4.4.8-1
php-symfony-amazon-mailer - 4.4.8-1
php-symfony-amazon-sqs-messenger - 4.4.8-1

criterions.comment: symfony package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.8-1').
